verses.verse: My son <WH1121>, forget <WH7911> <WH8799> not my Torah <WH8451>; but let thine heart <WH3820> keep <WH5341> <WH8799> my Mitzvot <WH4687>:
For length <WH753> of days <WH3117>, and long <WH8141> life <WH2416>, and peace <WH7965>, shall they add <WH3254> <WH8686> to thee.

Let not mercy <WH2617> and truth <WH571> forsake <WH5800> <WH8799> thee: bind <WH7194> <WH8798> them about thy neck <WH1621>; write <WH3789> <WH8798> them upon the table <WH3871> of thine heart <WH3820>:
So shalt thou find <WH4672> <WH8798> favour <WH2580> and good <WH2896> understanding <WH7922> in the sight <WH5869> of 'Elohim <WH430> and man <WH120>.
Trust <WH982> <WH8798> in the YY <WH3068> with all thine heart <WH3820>; and lean <WH8172> <WH8735> not unto thine own understanding <WH998>.
In all thy ways <WH1870> acknowledge <WH3045> <WH8798> him, and he shall direct <WH3474> <WH8762> thy paths <WH734>.
Be not wise <WH2450> in thine own eyes <WH5869>: fear <WH3372> <WH8798> the YY <WH3068>, and depart <WH5493> <WH8798> from evil <WH7451>.
It shall be health <WH7500> to thy navel <WH8270>, and marrow <WH8250> to thy bones <WH6106>.
Honour <WH3513> <WH8761> the YY <WH3068> with thy substance <WH1952>, and with the firstfruits <WH7225> of all thine increase <WH8393>:
So shall thy barns <WH618> be filled <WH4390> <WH8735> with plenty <WH7647>, and thy presses <WH3342> shall burst out <WH6555> <WH8799> with new wine <WH8492>.
My son <WH1121>, despise <WH3988> <WH8799> not the chastening <WH4148> of the YY <WH3068>; neither be weary <WH6973> <WH8799> of his correction <WH8433>:
For whom the YY <WH3068> loveth <WH157> <WH8799> he correcteth <WH3198> <WH8686>; even as a father <WH1> the son <WH1121> in whom he delighteth <WH7521> <WH8799>.
Happy <WH835> is the man <WH120> that findeth <WH4672> <WH8804> wisdom <WH2451>, and the man <WH120> that getteth <WH6329> <WH8686> understanding <WH8394>.
For the merchandise <WH5504> of it is better <WH2896> than the merchandise <WH5505> of silver <WH3701>, and the gain <WH8393> thereof than fine gold <WH2742>.
She is more precious <WH3368> than rubies <WH6443>: and all the things thou canst desire <WH2656> are not to be compared <WH7737> <WH8799> unto her.
Length <WH753> of days <WH3117> is in her right hand <WH3225>; and in her left hand <WH8040> riches <WH6239> and honour <WH3519>.
Her ways <WH1870> are ways <WH1870> of pleasantness <WH5278>, and all her paths <WH5410> are peace <WH7965>.
She is a tree <WH6086> of life <WH2416> to them that lay hold <WH2388> <WH8688> upon her: and happy <WH833> <WH8794> is every one that retaineth <WH8551> <WH8802> her.
The YY <WH3068> by wisdom <WH2451> hath founded <WH3245> <WH8804> the earth <WH776>; by understanding <WH8394> hath he established <WH3559> <WH8790> the heavens <WH8064>.
By his knowledge <WH1847> the depths <WH8415> are broken up <WH1234> <WH8738>, and the clouds <WH7834> drop down <WH7491> <WH8799> the dew <WH2919>.
My son <WH1121>, let not them depart <WH3868> <WH8799> from thine eyes <WH5869>: keep <WH5341> <WH8798> sound wisdom <WH8454> and discretion <WH4209>:
So shall they be life <WH2416> unto thy soul <WH5315>, and grace <WH2580> to thy neck <WH1621>.
Then shalt thou walk <WH3212> <WH8799> in thy way <WH1870> safely <WH983>, and thy foot <WH7272> shall not stumble <WH5062> <WH8799>.
When thou liest down <WH7901> <WH8799>, thou shalt not be afraid <WH6342> <WH8799>: yea, thou shalt lie down <WH7901> <WH8804>, and thy sleep <WH8142> shall be sweet <WH6149> <WH8804>.
Be not afraid <WH3372> <WH8799> of sudden <WH6597> fear <WH6343>, neither of the desolation <WH7722> of the wicked <WH7563>, when it cometh <WH935> <WH8799>.
For the YY <WH3068> shall be thy confidence <WH3689>, and shall keep <WH8104> <WH8804> thy foot <WH7272> from being taken <WH3921>.
Withhold <WH4513> <WH8799> not good <WH2896> from them to whom it is due <WH1167>, when it is in the power <WH410> of thine hand <WH3027> to do <WH6213> <WH8800> it.
Say <WH559> <WH8799> not unto thy neighbour <WH7453>, Go <WH3212> <WH8798>, and come again <WH7725> <WH8798>, and to morrow <WH4279> I will give <WH5414> <WH8799>; when thou hast <WH3426> it by thee.
Devise <WH2790> <WH8799> not evil <WH7451> against thy neighbour <WH7453>, seeing he dwelleth <WH3427> <WH8802> securely <WH983> by thee.
Strive <WH7378> <WH8799> not with a man <WH120> without cause <WH2600>, if he have done <WH1580> <WH8804> thee no harm <WH7451>.
Envy <WH7065> <WH8762> thou not the oppressor <WH376> <WH2555>, and choose <WH977> <WH8799> none of his ways <WH1870>.
For the froward <WH3868> <WH8737> is abomination <WH8441> to the YY <WH3068>: but his secret <WH5475> is with the righteous <WH3477>.
The curse <WH3994> of the YY <WH3068> is in the house <WH1004> of the wicked <WH7563>: but he blesseht <WH1288> <WH8762> the habitation <WH5116> of the just <WH6662>.
Surely he scorneth <WH3887> <WH8686> the scorners <WH3887> <WH8801>: but he giveth <WH5414> <WH8799> grace <WH2580> unto the lowly <WH6035> <WH8675> <WH6041>.
The wise <WH2450> shall inherit <WH5157> <WH8799> glory <WH3519>: but shame <WH7036> shall be the promotion <WH7311> <WH8688> of fools <WH3684>.
